result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($500.00 signature bond) LW

Justice Point Discharge Report, filed.
Defendant is in bench warrant status. Court takes no further action at this time.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

Defendant Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez not in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez.  Student Intern Kevin Clancey under the supervision of Attorney  Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Court orders $250.00 previously set signature bond vacated and sets $500.00 signature bond. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for return on warrant. Bail/bond hearing proceeded. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court vacates previous forfeited signature bond of $250.00 and increases signature bond to $500.00 with conditions. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on September 8, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until September 13, 2022 at  1:30 PM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.  Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Per Intake week- case is being re-tabbed to judicial official Judge Swanson, Branch 11.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($250.00 signature bond) LW
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez not in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of her release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case scheduled for Preliminary Hearing and entry into Drug Treatment Court. Defendant is no longer eligible for Drug Treatment Court. Case to be reassigned to Judge Grayson branch 16. Preliminary time limits previously waived. Defense requests case be heard in Preliminary Court. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No VIOLENT Contact Order with R.G.R.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richaira Liz Garcia - Hernandez in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case also in court for Calendar Call. Defense provideds update to the court. Court WITHDRAWS previously stayed bench warrant. 

  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case adjourned for Initial Appearance and Calendar Call in Branch 21.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:50 am.
received and filed.
Received and Filed, Notice of Completion of Representation
received and filed.
